item.title: chks
item.description: User-written Stata command to estimate a Nonlinear Index, or a Zero Stochastic Frontier Model.

item.title: Current course
item.description: User-written Stata command to estimate a Nonlinear Index, or a Zero Stochastic Frontier Model.

item.title: Energy Shocks, Firms' Productivity and Markups
item.description: This paper studies how firms’ outcomes (i.e., productivity and markups) respond to cost shocks (electricity prices).

item.title: The Effects of Hiring Discrimination over the Business Cycle
item.description: We explore whether hiring discrimination implies a higher volatility of labor market outcomes for discriminated groups in the context of a standard search-and-matching model with an urn-ball matching function.

item.title: Export Diversification Dynamics in Latin America
item.description: In this chapter, we construct a set of export diversification measures in order to give a detailed view of export diversification dynamics in Latin America.

I am a fourth-year Ph.D. student in Economics at the State University of New York at Binghamton. I also hold an appointment as professor of economics at U.S.T.-Chile. My research interests are in Macroeconomics, Econometrics, and Industrial Organization. This semester I am teaching Introduction to Econometrics at Binghamton University and working on my thesis. In this website you can find information related to teaching, research, resources, such as user-written econometric packages, and my CV.
